page.title: 01Askham Richard/Bryan Area
page.content: Askham Richard and Askham Bryan are small villages,about two miles apart.They are about five miles south-west of York. A major road,the A64,runs close to both villages and provides easy access to the city of Leeds and to York. Both villages were originally farming communities but the number of farms has decreased and many residents now commute to York or Leeds for their work. Each village has its own church and they share a primary school which is located in Askham Richard. Until recent times each village had its own shop but only one of these remains,at Askham Bryan. People visit York or Leeds to do their shopping.
